p: The suitability of room temperature ionic liquids as solvents for redox flow batteries (RFBs) containing metal complexes was investigated by Ejigu et al. [ 42], using metal acetylacetonate (acac) complexes [M(acac) 3], (M = Mn, Cr, or V) in imidazolium based RTILs. They detected, by cyclic voltammetry at a glassy carbon electrode, an irreversible behaviour for [Mn(acac) 3] and [Cr(acac) 3] in 1-ethyl-3-methylimidazolium bis(trifluoromethanesulfonyl)imide [emim][NTf 2], but the rate of the Mn 2+/Mn 3+ reaction increased when Au electrodes were used.
